I am now able to compile Cantera on 64-bit Alpha by using the
-D__USE_STD_I=
OSTREAM option.  However, the program fails when linking
cti2ctml.o and I g=
et the following error:

cxx -o
/nfs/fe01/d1/cfd/charestm/CFDkit+caboodle_x=
86/cantera/build/bin/alphaev68-unknown-linux-gnu/cti2ctml
cti2ctml.o
-L/nfs=
/fe01/d1/cfd/charestm/CFDkit+caboodle_x86/cantera/build/lib/alphaev68-unkno=
wn-linux-gnu
 
-L/nfs/fe01/d1/cfd/charestm/CFDkit+caboodle_x86/cantera/buil=
d/lib/alphaev68-unknown-linux-gnu
-D__USE_STD_IOSTREAM -lcantera -ltpx -lct=
cxx  \
               -lctf2c -lm
/nfs/fe01/d1/cfd/charestm/CFDkit+caboodle=
_x86/cantera/build/lib/alphaev68-unknown-linux-gnu/libcantera.a(misc.o)(.te=
xt+0x1cbc):
undefined reference to `std::basic_string<T0, T1, T2>&
std::bas=
ic_string<T0=3Dchar, T1=3Dstd::char_traits<char>,
T2=3Dstd::allocator<char>=
 >::append(const std::basic_string<T0, T1, T2>&)'

Any suggestions?  I thin=
k that I need to set the -std gnu flag during
compiling.  However, setting =
CPPFLAG=3D"-std gnu" in preconfig doesn't
actually do anything.  Alternativ=
ely, if I set CXXFLAG, the option is
used everywhere (even for ccc) and  I =
get the following message:

ccc -std gnu -D__USE_STD_IOSTREAM  -o chkll -DN=
O_FPINIT arithchk.c -lm ||\
 ccc -DNO_LONG_LONG -std gnu -D__USE_STD_IOSTRE=
AM  -o chkll
-DNO_FPINIT arithchk.c -lm
/usr/bin/ld: cannot open gnu: No su=
ch file or directory
collect2: ld returned 1 exit status
/usr/bin/ld: canno=
t open gnu: No such file or directory

Any help would be greatly appreciate=
d.

Marc


--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "squirlyjoe" <marcc@...> wrote:
=
>
> I have had the same problem when compiling with 64-bit Alpha (Red Hat
>=
 Linux 7.0).  I was able to compile the code using g++ but cannot link
> th=
e cantera libraries to code compiled using the compaq cxx compiler.
>     D=
uring linking, I get undefined references. 
> 
> I am also trying to compil=
e cantera on 64-bit Itanium (Red Hat
> Enterprise Linux AS release 3 ) with=
 no success thus far.
> 
> Marc
> 
> --- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "vince=
nzomulone" <vmulone@> wrote:
> >
> > Hi everyone, 
> > does anyone have any=
 news on compiling cantera on 64-bit machines? 
> > I'm trying to do that o=
n a 64-bit Alpha one (Red Hat Linux 7.0). 
> >  
> > First of all I switche=
d off all the python/matlab stuff and it seems 
> > to build quite correctl=
y all the directory lib, but when it goes to 
> > build the binary cti2ctml=
, it gives an ld segmentation fault. 
> > (exactly the following error: "co=
llect2: ld terminated with signal 
> > 11 [Segmentation fault] /usr/bin/ld:=
 bfd assertion fail 
> > elf64-alpha.c:3006"). 
> >  
> > But the worst thi=
ng is that, more generally, I don't succeed in 
> > creating any shared lib=
raries with the even compiled libraries for 
> > the same error of the dyna=
mic linker. 
> >  
> > Do you have any idea to fix this problem? 
> > Thank=
 you all. Vincenzo.
> >
>
